revised_title: Ancient Chinese Solar Observations and Solar Variability
tldr: This article discusses the history of solar observations in ancient China, focusing on sunspot observations and their impact on understanding solar activity over the past 2000 years. The author reconstructs a new sunspot catalogue using various sources, including official histories and local gazettes, and analyzes the power spectrum of solar activity. The study reveals the significance of the 10.62-year Schwabe cycle and the potential influence of a 210-year cycle on solar activity and future forecasting.
